column4: Hey, I'm trying to uninstall Courier (IMAP), but accidentally deleted /etc/courier.  Now whenever I run apt-get remove courier-imap, I get errors from dpkg about a missing config file.  Is there a way I can let aptitude know that the package is gone?
edit /etc/init.d/courier-imap. Make the second line read: exit 0
then after removing, install it and remove it again
looks like you deleted lots of configfiles manually. remove all packages related to dovecot, mysql and courier and try again
despite the fact that "The End of All Hope" was playing in the background, things are working now.  Thanks for your help
